definition: Zhou Enlai (1898-1976), Chinese communist leader, prime minister 1949-1976
surname Zhou/Zhou Dynasty (1046-256 BC)
to make a circuit/to circle/circle/circumference/lap/cycle/complete/all/all over/thorough/to help financially
favor/grace/kindness
to come/to arrive/to come round/ever since/next

sentences.english: Premier Zhou En- lai worked hard all his life in behalf of the Chinese revolution.
sentences.chinese: 周恩來總理畢生爲中國革命鞠躬盡瘁。

sentences.english: Our beloved Premier Zhou Enlai is the outstanding representative of this area.
sentences.chinese: 我們敬愛的周恩來總理就是這方面的傑出代表。

sentences.english: Comrade Zhou Enlai was in a very difficult position at the time of the 1971 National Conference on Education.
sentences.chinese: 一九七一年全教會時，周恩來同志處境很困難。

sentences.english: Zhou was the consummate diplomat, but also a considerable wit.
sentences.chinese: 周恩來是個完美的外交家，也同時是位智者。

sentences.english: I stood not far away from Premier Chou Enlai.
sentences.chinese: 我站在周恩來的不遠處。

sentences.english: The core of Zhou En-lai's spirit is to serve the people.
sentences.chinese: 周恩來精神的核心是全心全意爲人民服務。

sentences.english: Good-neighbor policy is one of the important parts of Zhou Enlai foreign thoughts.
sentences.chinese: 睦鄰外交是周恩來外交思想的重要組成部分。

sentences.english: All life of Zhou Enlai, there are a lot of time is spent in negotiations.
sentences.chinese: 周恩來的一生，有許多時間是在談判桌上度過的。

sentences.english: Comrade Zhou Enlai finally departed from us.
sentences.chinese: 周恩來同志和我們永別了。

sentences.english: I turned around and had a look. Oh – it was Zhou Enlai.

definition: Mao Zedong (1893-1976), Chinese communist leader
Chiang Kai-shek (1887-1975), military leader, head of the Nationalist government in China 1928-1949 and the government in exile on Taiwan 1950-1975
Dr Sun Yat-sen (1866-1925), first president of the Republic of China and co-founder of the Guomintang 國民黨|国民党/same as 孫逸仙|孙逸仙
Song Qingling or Rosemonde Soong (1893-1981), wife of Sun Yat-sen 孫中山|孙中山[Sun1 Zhong1 shan1]
Premier Zhou Enlai 周恩來|周恩来 (1898-1976)
Deng Xiaoping (1904-1997), Chinese communist leader, de facto leader of PRC 1978-1990 and creator of "socialism with Chinese characteristics"
Chen Yi (1901-1972), communist general and politician, Marshal of PLA from 1955, Mayor of Shanghai in 1950s, PRC foreign minister 1958-1972
Liu Shaoqi (1898-1969), Chinese communist leader, a martyr of the Cultural Revolution
Soong Mei-ling (1898-2003), Chiang Kai-shek's second wife
Zhang Shizhao (1881-1973), revolutionary journalist in Shanghai, then established writer
He Long (1896-1969), important communist military leader, died from persecution during the Cultural Revolution
Wang Ching-wei (1883-1944), left-wing Guomingdang politician, subsequently Japanese collaborator
Hu Shi (1891-1962), original proponent of writing in colloquial Chinese 白話文|白话文[bai2 hua4 wen2]
Zhang Xueliang (1901-2001) son of Fengtian clique warlord, then senior general for the Nationalists and subsequently for the People's Liberation Army
Yuan Shikai (1859-1916), senior general of late Qing, subsequently warlord and self-proclaimed emperor of China
Nikita Khrushchev (1894-1971), secretary-general of Soviet Communist Party 1953-1964
